Hi! I am Manal K. Elzalabany, a multilingual epidemiologist, working currently as data analyst at Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine, UK. Previously worked as a Research Associate & Data Scientist in MPIDR, Germany & on COVID-19 detection & data analysis, outbreaks' response in WHO, and as a Lancet-associated researcher.\
\
My research interests are epidemics, global health, armed conflicts & health data analytics, particularly: infectious diseases outbreaks analytics & causal inference using observational data.\
\
I hold MSc Applied Statistics in Health Sciences from Strathclyde university, 2024, MPH in Epidemiology & Biostatistics from the American University of Beirut, 2018, and BVSc in Veterinary Medical Sciences from Cairo University, 2009 . Manal is an expert user of R/ RStudio, Rmarkdown & Quarto, and Shiny Web applications, among other analysis tools.
